name: Jogging
description: Easy-paced running for aerobic base building

name: Treadmill Run
description: Indoor running on a treadmill

name: Hill Repeats Run
description: Repeated uphill running bouts with jog-down recovery

name: Fartlek Run
description: Unstructured speed play alternating faster and easy running
instructions: Alternate fast segments with easy jogs

name: Tempo Run
description: Sustained comfortably hard running at threshold effort
instructions: Run 20–40 minutes at steady hard pace

name: Track Intervals
description: Structured running intervals on a track with recovery periods
instructions: Alternate fast laps with easy jog recoveries

name: Long Slow Distance Run
description: Extended easy run to build aerobic capacity
tips: Increase long run by 10% max per week

name: Beach Running
description: Running on sand for increased demand and reduced impact
instructions: Choose firmer wet sand near waterline

name: Road Cycling
description: Outdoor cycling on paved roads at steady pace

name: Mountain Biking
description: Off-road cycling on trails with varied terrain
tips: Lower tire pressure slightly for grip

name: Gravel Riding
description: Cycling on unpaved gravel roads for mixed-surface endurance
tips: Carry repair kit and spare tube

name: Cyclocross Drills
description: Short laps with dismounts and remounts for mixed-terrain endurance
instructions: Alternate hard laps with easy recovery

name: Indoor Bike
description: Indoor cycling session with adjustable intensity levels
instructions: Choose steady state or interval format
tips: Adjust resistance based on training goal

name: Pool Laps Easy
description: Continuous easy-effort lap swimming for aerobic base

name: Swim Intervals
description: Structured pool sets alternating fast and easy laps
tips: Focus on catch and body roll

name: Kickboard Laps
description: Swimming with kickboard to build leg endurance

name: Pull Buoy Laps
description: Upper-body focused swimming with pull buoy between legs

name: Aqua Jogging
description: Deep-water running to build endurance with minimal impact

name: Row Erg Steady State
description: Continuous moderate-effort rowing for aerobic capacity

name: Row Erg Pyramid
description: Rowing intervals with increasing then decreasing durations
instructions: Row 1-2-3-4-3-2-1 minutes hard with equal rest

name: Stair Sprints
description: Short uphill stair runs with walk-down recovery
tips: Keep torso tall and drive arms

name: Hiking
description: Steady outdoor walking on trails with elevation changes

name: Nordic Walking
description: Walking with poles to engage upper body and increase intensity

name: Race Walking
description: Technique-focused brisk walking with continuous ground contact

name: Stair Machine Endurance
description: Continuous climbing on a stair machine at steady pace

name: Elliptical Intervals
description: Alternating resistance and cadence on the elliptical
instructions: Alternate 1–2 minutes hard with 1–2 minutes easy

name: Assault Bike
description: Full-body fan bike training with adjustable intensity
tips: Can be done steady state or intervals

name: Erg Bike
description: Stationary bike ergometer training with precise power measurement
tips: Focus on power zones for training

name: SkiErg Steady
description: Upper-body dominant cardio using ski ergometer

name: Sprint
description: Short maximal-speed running over a short distance. Useful for intervals and speed work.
instructions: Sprint at maximum effort for the chosen distance or time

name: SkiErg Intervals
description: Alternating hard ski pulls with recovery periods
instructions: Perform 30–90s hard intervals with equal rest

name: Jump Rope Steady
description: Continuous jump rope for cardiovascular endurance

name: Jump Rope Intervals
description: Timed rope skipping bouts with brief rests
instructions: Alternate 1 minute fast with 1 minute easy

name: Shadow Boxing Rounds
description: Continuous shadow boxing with timed rounds
tips: Light on feet to conserve energy

name: Heavy Bag Rounds
description: Punching heavy bag with active footwork for endurance

name: Battle Rope Waves
description: Sustained alternating rope waves for cardio conditioning
instructions: Slight knee bend and neutral spine
tips: Relax grip to avoid forearm burn

name: Kettlebell Snatch Sets
description: High-rep kettlebell snatches performed in sets for endurance

name: Kettlebell Swing EMOM
description: Every-minute-on-the-minute kettlebell swings for sustained effort
instructions: Perform set reps at start of each minute

name: Bodyweight Circuit
description: Continuous circuit of bodyweight moves with minimal rest

name: Row-Bike-Run Brick
description: Back-to-back cardio modalities to build multi-sport endurance

name: Duathlon Brick
description: Run–bike–run training session mimicking duathlon format

name: Triathlon Brick
description: Combined swim, bike, and run session for race specificity

name: Row-Run Intervals
description: Alternating rowing bouts with treadmill or track runs

name: Swim-Run Sets
description: Repeated short swims followed by short runs for multi-environment endurance

name: Rowing Marathon Prep
description: Long-duration low-intensity indoor rowing for ultra-endurance

name: Cycling Hill Repeats
description: Repeated climbs at strong effort with easy descents

name: Commuter Cycling
description: Daily practical cycling at easy-to-moderate pace

name: Rowing Sprint Intervals
description: Short near-max rowing efforts with full recovery

name: Treadmill Incline Hike
description: Steady incline walk to simulate uphill hiking

name: Stadium Steps
description: Continuous stair walking or jogging in a stadium

name: Outdoor Circuit Stations
description: Rotating through park stations for continuous cardio-muscular work

name: Row-Run-Bike Tri-Circuit
description: Three-modality indoor circuit for sustained aerobic work

name: Rucking Hills
description: Weighted pack walking on hilly terrain for endurance and strength

name: Beach Walk
description: Steady walking on sand for low-impact endurance

name: Outdoor Skating

name: Row-Ski Erg Combo
description: Alternating rowing and ski erg bouts for full-body endurance

description: Longer pull buoy sets for sustained upper-body aerobic work

name: Rowing Technique Drills
description: Low-intensity technical rowing with continuous movement

Pick drills and rotate every 2–3 minutes

description: Choreographed step platform workout at steady intensity

name: Low-Impact Cardio Class
description: Continuous low-impact movements to elevate heart rate

name: Zumba

name: Rowing Bike Erg Combo
description: Alternating rowing and bike erg in sustained blocks

name: Rowing Power 10s

name: Indoor Track Walking

name: Outdoor Tempo Walk
